examples: The heat was really on at work.
That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The children enjoyed a refreshing slice of watermelon on a hot summer day.
On the credit side, the restaurant offers a wide range of choices.
Our company puts the emphasis on quality.
words.defineEn: used to show a day or date
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để hiển thị một ngày hoặc ngày

examples: The town is three miles away.
The days passed slowly.
The manager played his strongest side of the season.
The company kicked off the CEO for embezzlement.
The company kicked off the CEO for embezzlement.
words.defineEn: used when referring to a person or thing that was previously mentioned or one that is identified easily
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi đề cập đến một người hoặc vật đã được đề cập trước đó hoặc một thứ được xác định dễ dàng

examples: The car holds the corners very well.
A bus appeared around the corner.
She drew a yellow sun on the corner of the paper.
He has a cozy corner in his home where he can meditate.
There's a chemist around the corner.
words.defineEn: a point or area at which two edges, sides, or lines meet
words.defineVi: một điểm hoặc khu vực mà tại đó hai cạnh, cạnh hoặc đường giao nhau

examples: My father pays his bills at the beginning of the month.
My friends enjoyed tangy barbecue gammon skewers at the summer barbecue.
The professor made mincemeat of the speaker at the conference.
My friends enjoyed smoky beef rib chops at the countryside barbecue.
The lingonberry sauce perfectly complemented the roasted turkey at Thanksgiving dinner.
words.defineEn: used to show a particular place or position
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để hiển thị một địa điểm hoặc vị trí cụ thể

examples: The car stopped at the traffic lights.
After the traffic lights, turn right.
The power outage caused the traffic lights to go haywire.
Wait for the traffic lights to change.
They have surveillance helicopters, access to drones, traffic lights with surveillance capabilities.
words.defineEn: a set of lights, often colored in red, yellow, and green, that control the traffic on a road
words.defineVi: một bộ đèn, thường có màu đỏ, vàng và xanh lục, điều khiển giao thông trên đường

examples: The universal language of art is bridging a divide.
This collection of stories bridges the gap between history and fiction.
This book bridges a gulf between the metaphysics literature and philosophy of mind literature.
The bus hit the bridge.
The children were dropping stones off the bridge.
words.defineEn: a structure built over a river, road, etc. that enables people or vehicles to go across one side to the other
words.defineVi: một cấu trúc được xây dựng trên sông, đường, v.v. cho phép người hoặc phương tiện đi qua bên này sang bên kia

examples: She stopped the car opposite the school.
The CEO is meeting her opposite number at Fukuda Electronics to discuss a possible joint venture.
The Foreign Secretary is currently having talks with his opposite number in the White House.
He was proud to be playing opposite a famous actor.
Do you agree that the opposite side of the coin is too often untold?
words.defineEn: on the other side of an area when seen from a particular vantage point
words.defineVi: ở phía bên kia của một khu vực khi nhìn từ một điểm thuận lợi cụ thể

examples: The sunflower turned its face towards the sun.
The victory turned the tide of the war in North Africa.
The thunder had turned the milk.
Police turned water cannon on the rioters.
Turn the mould upside down.
words.defineEn: to move in a circular direction around a fixed line or point
words.defineVi: di chuyển theo hướng tròn xung quanh một đường hoặc điểm cố định

examples: I've got two left feet!
She turned the wheel sharply to the left.
I got a sudden pain in my left eye.
The left didn't know what the right was doing in this gross teen horror comedy.
On the left the ground drops away, giving a view over the rooftops.
words.defineEn: toward or located on the same side as the heart of most people
words.defineVi: hướng tới hoặc nằm cùng phía với trái tim của hầu hết mọi người

examples: Right, pin back your ears, everyone.
That extension is busy right now.
I want a dish of creamy mushroom bucatini with Parmesan right now.
Right by holding the candle to the devil.
After the traffic lights, turn right.
words.defineEn: the direction or side that is toward the east when someone or something is facing north
words.defineVi: hướng hoặc mặt hướng về phía đông khi ai đó hoặc thứ gì đó hướng về phía bắc

examples: The Siemens display goes the whole hog.
The cruise went very quickly.
My laptop went haywire
To go swimming/fishing/jogging.
The email went to everyone in the company.
words.defineEn: to travel or move from one location to another location
words.defineVi: để đi du lịch hoặc di chuyển từ một địa điểm đến một địa điểm khác

examples: She guessed the answer straight away.
The guard stood straight as a ramrod.
They clicked straight away.
He gives it to you straight.
Sometimes he spoke straight from the shoulder and sometimes in puzzles
words.defineEn: in a manner that is not curved

examples: The railway line runs right past the house.
The clock says ten past two.
Not a single jot or tittle goes past the eye of the boss without her noticing.
The cat ran right past me and into the house.
His past comes back to hunt him when an old friend returns to his life.
words.defineEn: from one side of something to the other
words.defineVi: từ bên này sang bên kia

examples: The church had a more important part to play in the community.
The Medieval church went to some lengths to specify the roles of particular stones in religious imagery.
We've become poor as church mice ever since the bank raised the interest rates on our mortgage.
There were nine church leaders in my group and all bared their hearts.
We stood outside the church, hoping to catch a glimpse of the bride.
words.defineEn: a building where Christians go to worship and practice their religion
words.defineVi: một tòa nhà nơi các Kitô hữu đến thờ phượng và thực hành tôn giáo của họ

examples: The struggle ended indecisively.
The surfaced road ends at the farm.
Grab the end of the rope.’
The play has too many loose ends.
All good things come to an end.
words.defineEn: the final part of something, such as an event, a story, etc.
words.defineVi: phần cuối cùng của một cái gì đó, chẳng hạn như một sự kiện, một câu chuyện, vv

examples: The brochure speaks of beautiful secluded grounds.
What's your shirt made of?
Ha, yeah right, and the moon is made of cheese.
The professor made mincemeat of the speaker at the conference.
The kangaroo was making mincemeat of him.
words.defineEn: used to indicate origin or derivation
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ ra nguồn gốc hoặc nguồn gốc

examples: Cobbled streets run down to a tiny harbor.
The new smartphone is streets ahead of its predecessor, with a larger screen and more powerful processor.
The experienced lawyer is streets ahead of her young colleagues, with a deep understanding of the law and years of courtroom experience.
The street vendor served crispy trotter bites with a tangy dipping sauce at the food market.
The protesters raised their cries for justice and equality in the streets.
words.defineEn: a public path for vehicles in a village, town, or city, usually with buildings, houses, etc. on its sides
words.defineVi: một con đường công cộng dành cho các phương tiện trong một ngôi làng, thị trấn hoặc thành phố, thường có các tòa nhà, nhà ở, v.v. ở hai bên
